abstract_summ: The corresponding software to layout and resolve samples is freely available under a BSD license (https://github.com/phiweger/clonepool).Background: Worldwide demand for SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR testing is increasing as more countries are impacted by COVID-19 and as testing remains central to contain the spread of the disease, both in countries where the disease is emerging and in countries that are past the first wave but exposed to re-emergence.Results: Individual RT-PCR testing identified 25 positive samples.Pooling of samples can increase lab capacity when using Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) to detect infections such as COVID-However, pool testing is typically performed via an adaptive testing strategy which requires a feedback loop in the lab and at least two PCR runs to confirm positive results.To investigate this possibility, detection rates in pooled samples were evaluated, with extensive assessment of pools containing weak positive specimens.We discuss a non-adaptive testing method where each sample is distributed in a prescribed manner over several pools, and which yields reliable results after one round of testing.
title_summ: Optimal size of sample pooling for RNA pool testing: an avant-garde for scaling up SARS CoV 2 testingRapid, Large-Scale, and Effective Detection of COVID-19 Via Non-Adaptive TestingPooling RT-PCR or NGS samples has the potential to cost-effectively generate estimates of COVID-19 prevalence in resource limited environmentsFAST: a Feasible, Accurate and Speedy Test Strategy for COVID-19Assessment of sample pooling for clinical SARS-CoV-2 testingEvaluation of COVID-19 RT-qPCR test in multi-sample poolsEvaluating efficiency of pooling specimens for PCR-based detection of COVID-19FACT- Frankfurt adjusted COVID-19 testing- a novel method enables high-throughput SARS-CoV-2 screening without loss of sensitivityIncreased PCR screening capacity using a multi-replicate pooling schemeHigh-sensitivity COVID-19 group testing by digital PCRPurim: a rapid method with reduced cost for massive detection of CoVid-19Assessment of Specimen Pooling to Conserve SARS CoV-2 Testing ResourcesAssessment of Specimen Pooling to Conserve SARS CoV-2 Testing ResourcesEvaluating the efficiency of specimen pooling for PCR‐based detection of COVID‐19Overcoming the bottleneck to widespread testing: A rapid review of nucleic acid testing approaches for COVID-19 detection.
title_abstract_phrases: The corresponding software to layout and resolve samples is freely available under a BSD license (https://github.com/phiweger/clonepool).High-sensitivity COVID-19 group testing by digital PCRBackground: Worldwide demand for SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR testing is increasing as more countries are impacted by COVID-19 and as testing remains central to contain the spread of the disease, both in countries where the disease is emerging and in countries that are past the first wave but exposed to re-emergence.Results: Individual RT-PCR testing identified 25 positive samples.Rapid, Large-Scale, and Effective Detection of COVID-19 Via Non-Adaptive TestingPooling of samples can increase lab capacity when using Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) to detect infections such as COVID-However, pool testing is typically performed via an adaptive testing strategy which requires a feedback loop in the lab and at least two PCR runs to confirm positive results.Pooling specimens did not affect the sensitivity of detecting SARS-CoV-2, and the PCR cycle threshold (Ct) between testing of pooling specimen and subsequent individual testing was not significantly different using paired t-test.We discuss a non-adaptive testing method where each sample is distributed in a prescribed manner over several pools, and which yields reliable results after one round of testing.
